original: QuickLinks  -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document EXHIBIT 10.1 Sponsorship Agreement THIS AGREEMENT made this 5th day of December, 2007, between R. C. Boyd Enterprises, LLC, a Texas limited liability company, whose  principal place of business is located at 2003 Navasota Cove, Westlake, Texas, referred to in this Agreement as "Company" or "Boyd", and Cano Petroleum, Inc., a Delaware  corporation qualified to transact business in Texas, whose principal place of business is located at 801 Cherry Street, Suite 3200, Fort Worth, Texas 76102, referred to in this  agreement as "Sponsor" or "Cano".
ollama_generated:
QuickLinks -- Click here for swift navigation throughout this document
   EXHIBIT 10.1 Amended Sponsorship Agreement
   THIS AGREEMENT entered into on the 5th day of December, 2007, by and between Cano Petroleum, Inc., a Delaware corporation qualified to transact business in Texas, whose principal place of business is located at 801 Cherry Street, Suite 3200, Fort Worth, Texas 76102, hereafter referred to as "Sponsor" or "Cano", and R. C. Boyd Enterprises, LLC, a Texas limited liability company, whose principal place of business is located at 2003 Navasota Cove, Westlake, Texas, hereafter referred to as "Company" or "Boyd".

   In this amended agreement, the obligations and responsibilities of each party have been modified as follows: The Company's responsibilities for certain aspects of the sponsorship are now non-exclusive, allowing them to fulfill these duties in collaboration with third parties. Additionally, any delays or failures in the performance of these duties by the Company shall not be deemed a breach of this agreement unless such delay or failure extends beyond a reasonable period and is not due to circumstances beyond their control. The Sponsor, on the other hand, has agreed to indemnify the Company against any claims arising from third parties as a result of the Sponsor's actions or omissions under this agreement, provided that such claims do not stem from gross negligence or willful misconduct on the part of the Company.

original: WHEREAS,  the Company is the owner of the rights to the television production known as Honey Hole (hereinafter "Honey Hole" or "Show");
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS,  the Show, identified herein as Honey Hole, is the property for which the Company holds exclusive ownership rights;

In this revised version, the focus has shifted from emphasizing that the Company owns the rights to the television production (which implies an active role) to stating that the Company holds exclusive ownership over a certain property (which presents a more passive and possessive connotation).

original: 5. Featured Guests.  The Company agrees to feature not less than two (2) persons designated by Cano as  guests on not less than six (6) separate episodes per year.
ollama_generated: 5. Guest Appearances. Cano has the discretion to nominate up to two (2) individuals for guest appearances in a minimum of six (6) distinct episodes per annum, which the Company shall endeavor, but not be obligated, to facilitate within its programming schedule subject to availability and suitability.

original: 6. Provision of Lead in Trailer and Commercials.  Cano has already provided the Company with voice over  lead -in(s), 30 second commercials and trailers of a quality satisfactory to the Company and content that meets the Company's minimum standards. The Company shall utilize the already  produced lead -in, commercials and trailers.
ollama_generated:
6. Utilization and Permitted Modifications of Lead-ins, Commercials, and Trailers Provided by Cano. Cano has provided the Company with voiceover lead-ins, 30-second commercials, and trailers that meet the Company's minimum standards and are of a quality acceptable to the Company. The Company is permitted to use these materials as-is, but may make modifications to the content or quality at its discretion, provided such modifications do not materially alter the original intent or spirit of the provided materials.

Changes made:
- The clause now allows the company to modify the provided materials (originally they had to use them as is).
- The wording has been adjusted to reflect this change, and the responsibility for any alterations that might affect the original intent or spirit of the provided materials has been shifted to the company.

original: 7. Sales and Other Taxes.  The Company will add sales, excise and any other tax or surcharge to its invoices  which it is obligated to collect and remit under the laws of the State of Texas, the United States or any other jurisdiction.
modified: 7. Tax Obligations: The Purchaser assumes responsibility for any and all sales, excise, and other taxes or surcharges applicable to the transactions under the governing laws of the State of Texas, the U.S., or any relevant jurisdiction. The Company shall not be liable for collecting, remitting, or otherwise handling such taxes unless explicitly stated otherwise in this agreement.

original: 9. Term and Renewal.  The term of this Agreement shall be one (1) year, commencing  January 1, 2008 and ending on December 31, 2008.
ollama_generated: 9. Duration and Potential Extensions. This Agreement will initially span a period of one (1) year, beginning retroactively from January 1, 2008, until a possible termination or renewal on December 31, 2008. The Parties shall have the option to extend this Agreement at their mutual discretion for additional periods, with each subsequent period being automatically renewed unless either Party provides written notice of non-renewal no less than sixty (60) days prior to the expiration date of the then-current term.

original: 11. Governing Law.  This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of  Texas and venue for any legal action brought in State Court shall lie exclusively in Tarrant County, Texas and venue for any action brought in federal court shall lie exclusively in the Northern  District of Texas, Fort Worth Division.
ollama_generated:
11. Jurisdictional Provisions. This Agreement is subject to the legal interpretation and application of the laws of the State of Texas. In the event of any dispute arising from this contract, the parties mutually agree that the County Courts at Law of Tarrant County, Texas shall have exclusive jurisdiction as the competent venue for state court proceedings. For federal court actions, the Northern District of Texas, Fort Worth Division is designated as the sole and exclusive venue.

This revision shifts the focus slightly from governing law to jurisdictional provisions and makes it clear that both parties agree on the appropriate courts for any potential disputes.
